headline: Did Goldman Sachs’ (GS) AI-Focused Software Hire and New Debt Shelf Just Redraw Its Investment Narrative?
summary: In recent days, Goldman Sachs appointed Qatalyst Partners co-founder Brian Cayne as global co-head of its software investment banking group, and it has been actively issuing a range of medium-term senior and subordinated notes under a new US$30.00 billion shelf registration. Together with its push into AI-focused software advisory and alternative investments, these moves highlight Goldman’s effort to deepen higher-fee franchises while broadening its funding flexibility across the maturity...
